meta.subject: Social Studies
meta.philosophy: Education is a vehicle through which a morally democratic learner should be developed. Thus, Social Studies is expected to be the mirror through which Zambian society should see itself in its quest and dedication to promote and perpetuate its social skills, beliefs, values, and traditions. Social Studies is a learning area that covers a number of aspects that include human behaviour, relationships, institutions, and resources. The learning area enables learners to use the acquired knowledge and skills to enable greater understanding of themselves, others, societies, institutions, nations, and environments.
meta.competence_learning: This new curriculum emphasises that the learner should be at the centre of the education process. Therefore, it is envisioned that the learners should acquire essential competences; and think reflectively, logically, scientifically, creatively and critically so as to promote the formation of positive social behaviour and a socially desirable attitude. It is desired that the learner should have an education that will shape the development of a personally held set of civic, moral, and spiritual values as well as further the acquisition of knowledge and understanding of Zambia's democratic and cultural institutions.
goals: Quality, life long education for all which is accessible, inclusive and relevant to individual, national and global needs and value systems
Providing national age-appropriate curriculum for learners in grades 4 to 6 aligned with Competence-Based Curriculum and 21st century skills
Imparting knowledge, skills, values, and positive attitudes to enable children to live and grow into productive and useful members of their communities and the Zambian society
Facilitating the holistic development of children's physical, mental, emotional, social, spiritual, and moral faculties
Developing knowledge, desirable lifelong skills, values, and positive attitudes needed for personal and national development
Cultivating a mindset, skills, values, and positive attitudes that prepare learners to live responsible lives and be protected from life-threatening vices
Shaping the moral up-bringing of a leaner
Promoting and perpetuating social skills, beliefs, values, and traditions
Enabling greater understanding of themselves, others, societies, institutions, nations, and environments
